history.proof: intros H. induction l. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHl. + sauto lq: on depth: 3. + sauto lq: on depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
l: list nat

Goal:
Forall (eq 0) l -> expand p l = 0

Premises:
Inductive eq (A : Type) (x : A) : A -> Prop := eq_refl : x = x Arguments eq {A}%type_scope Arguments eq_refl {A}%type_scope {x}, [A] _
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
expand = fix expand (p : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => x + p * expand p l0 end : nat -> list nat -> nat Arguments expand _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
expand_app : forall (p : nat) (l m : list nat), expand p (l ++ m) = expand p l + power (length l) p * expand p m
prime_in_decomp : forall (p : nat) (l : list nat), prime p -> Forall prime l -> divides p (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l) -> In p l
list_sum = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_sum _%list_scope
list_max = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.max 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_max _%list_scope
nat_new = fun l : list nat => S (lmax l) : list nat -> nat Arguments nat_new _%list_scope
prime_decomp_uniq : forall l m : list nat, Forall prime l -> Forall prime m -> fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 m -> l ~p m
nat_list_insert_Forall : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (x : nat) (l : list nat), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (nat_list_insert x l)
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
prime_decomp : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l /\ Forall prime l}
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
List.Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l
ForallOrdPairs_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
ForallOrdPairs_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
lprod_ge_1 : forall l : list nat, Forall prime l -> 1 <= fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
Forall_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : list A -> Type), Q nil -> (forall (b : A) (l : list A), P b -> Q (b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Q l

```coq
intros H.
induction l.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHl. auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. induction l. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHl. auto.
